title_en: Border troops will hold several more strikes at Heathrow airport during the half-year
summary_en:
Border troops will hold several strikes at Heathrow Airport during the half-year.
The PCS union expects the strikes to disrupt passport checks for travelers.
The airport management is working with the Ministry of Internal Affairs on contingency plans.
The strikes will take place on May 31, June 1 and 2, followed by three weeks of action.
More than 500 PCS union members will take part in strikes after a dispute over a new staffing table.
The Interior Ministry said it was open to discussing the resolution, but responded to a request for a meeting only after threats of further action.
A spokeswoman for Heathrow Airport said they would be working with the Home Office on contingency plans.
